lines.text:
[to a thug he has pinned against the wall]
You of course know what Seneca said about fine conduct. In letters to Vasilius he said that fine conduct is always spontaneous.
And had you known the quote, you'd have said to him, as Burke said when questioned on the French Revolution in 1790, "Patience will achieve more than force."
I'm a two-bit philosopher. That's who I am.
